org.spongepowered.api.data.manipulators.items

Interface BlockItemData

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<BlockItemData>, DataManipulator<BlockItemData>, DataSerializable, SingleValueData<BlockState,BlockItemData>

    public interface BlockItemData
extends SingleValueData<BlockState,BlockItemData>
    Represents data about a block being represented by this item data. Since blocks are not itemstacks, but an itemstack can place a block, some blocks even have custom states: BlockState. With a block state, it is possible to change the signature of an item for any reason.

    Note that some block states have properties that are only defined by the position the item block is placed. Some blocks may read some properties, and others may not read all properties.

    BlockStates are not representing complex data like inventories, if complex information is required, use a different DataManipulator type.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Gets the block state of this item representing a block.

    • Method Detail

      • getState

        BlockState getState()
        Gets the block state of this item representing a block.

        The BlockState is immutable, to change the block state, use setState(BlockState).

        Returns:
        The current blockstate represented by this item

      • setState

        void setState(BlockState state)
        Sets the block state of the block being represented by this item data.

        Since BlockStates are immutable (they return a new BlockState on modification), the block state used here is also immutable and applied directly to the item.

        It should be noted that the block type should be the same as the item type referenced on the item stack.

        Parameters:
        state - The new block state of the block
